div.class: contact-methods p-4 py-5 mt-auto border-dark border-top

article.p: The Jackson County Correctional Facility is located in Marianna, Florida and has a holding capacity of 327 inmates. In the summer of 1992, inmates were moved from the old jail located behind the Jackson County Court House to the new facility located on Penn Avenue.

The Correctional Facility has a staff of approximately 43 full-time certified correctional officers. Of these, there are two Lieutenants, five Sergeants, six Corporals, one Chief of Corrections, and one Captain. Other full-time positions consist of three Medical Personnel, one Maintenance Person, three Food Service Workers, and two Administrative Support positions.
article.h3: How do I deposit money in to an inmate’s account?

ol.li: Money may be deposited in an inmate’s account by our Lobby Kiosk (cash, credit/debit card). Lobby hours for depositing funds are 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM daily.

article.p: All funds must be deposited into an inmate’s account by Monday at 12:00 AM for them to purchase commissary for the following week.
article.h3: How much money can I send at one time?
article.p: There is no limit to how much can be sent, however inmates are only allowed to spend $70.00 per week from their account.
article.h3: Are inmates allowed to have anything dropped off to them?

ol.li: One pair of work boots (NO steel toe)

article.p: These items will only be accepted after the inmate fills out a request and it is approved by the Operations Captain or his or her designee. The items may be brought to the facility Monday through Friday between 8:00 AM and 3:00 PM.
article.h3: What if an inmate has medication she or he needs?
article.p: Medication is only accepted in the first 72 hours and must be in original unexpired bottle. If an inmate has medication to be dropped off, call and ask to speak to the medical department for approval. Medical personnel must be present at the facility to accept it. Medical staff are on duty seven days a week from 7:00 AM through 7:00 PM.
article.h3: How do I set up an inmate telephone account?
article.p: The inmate phone service is provided by Securus Technology. They can be contacted by phone at 800-844-6591.
Inmate visitation is once a week for one hour. Call 850-482-9651 extension: 210, specify the inmate you wish to visit and the day and time will be given to you for that inmate.

Only one visitor will be allowed in to visit at one time. We do not allow anyone to swap out during a visit. You must also have a valid picture ID and present it at the time of your visit. You must be appropriately dressed. Wearing articles of clothing such as mini-skirts, sleeveless shirts, low-cut tops, etc. will not be permitted. No items will be allowed into the visitation booth. Please be considerate of other visitors and do not let small children to become disorderly or wander around the visiting area.

No disorderly conduct towards other visitors, the inmates, or staff will be tolerated at any time. If such action occurs, we reserve the right to terminate the visit and suspend you from returning to visit.
article.h3: Are notary services available for documents requiring a notarized inmate’s signature?
article.p: The Jackson County Correctional Facility provides limited notary services exclusively for documents requiring a notarized inmate’s signature. Notary services are available on Wednesdays from 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM and Thursdays from 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM.

article.h3: The following extensions are provided for your convenience:
article.p:
Admin/Front Desk: 210
Kitchen: 217
Booking: 218
Medical: 220
Officer in Charge: 223
Commissary: 226
Classification: 228
